items.title: Razer launches new Wyvrn game dev platform with automated AI bug tester
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Razer introduces the Wyvrn developer platform featuring tools like AI QA Copilot for game testing and AI Gamer Copilot for real-time in-game tips.
- AI QA Copilot is a cloud-based plug-in designed to enhance quality assurance by automatically identifying bugs and optimizing testing time and costs.
- The platform also integrates Razer's Chroma RGB, THX Spatial Audio Plus, and Sensa HD Haptics software, with a partnership planned with Side for QA integration.

items.title: Day One brings its digital journaling app to Windows
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Automattic-owned Day One launched a Windows version of its journaling app, available on the Microsoft Store.
- The app offers a distraction-free experience similar to other platforms, is free to use, and currently does not count against the one-device syncing limit.
- Features include unlimited text entries, multimedia integration, local storage with end-to-end encryption, and plans for future AI enhancements such as context-aware journaling prompts.

items.title: The weeklong TikTok fight over whether NYC influencers are ‘boring’
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- A TikTok clip criticizing NYC influencers as 'boring' sparked widespread discourse.
- The clip was posted by user @martinifeeny and highlighted similarities among influencers' content and lifestyles.
- Responses included calls for more diverse influencer representation and reactions from the influencers themselves.
- The phenomenon reflects broader patterns in social media where homogeneity in content creation is common due to algorithmic pressures.
- The article argues that this trend is not an anomaly but a result of advertising incentives and technological constraints.

items.title: The Pixel 9A is a midrange phone that actually looks like a good deal
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Google announced the Pixel 9A, starting at $499.
- Features a larger 6.3-inch screen with 2,700 nits peak brightness.
- New Tensor G4 processor and better IP68 water resistance.
- Ditches the camera bump for a flush design, includes a 48MP main camera and 13MP ultrawide.
- Battery capacity increased to 5,100mAh with Qi wireless and 23W wired charging.
- Available with 8GB RAM and 128GB storage for $499; 256GB for $599.
- Seven years of OS upgrades and security support aimed at ensuring longevity.

items.title: Google Wallet is adding tap-to-pay for kids
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google Wallet will allow kids to download the app for tap-to-pay with parental consent.
- The feature will roll out over the next few weeks and lets kids store event tickets, library cards, and gift cards.
- Parents control access through the Family Link app and receive emails for each purchase.
- Kids can only add payment cards with permission and online purchases are not allowed.
- Tap-to-pay for kids will be available in the US, UK, Australia, Spain, and Poland.

items.title: The Playdate is about to get a price increase
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Playdate's price will increase by $30 on March 25th, from $199 to $229.
- Panic announced the price hike in an email to customers, citing increased manufacturing costs at their new factory.
- Customers can still purchase at the current price until March 25th, and refurbished units will be available for $179 starting on the same date.
- The price change is not related to tariffs as Malaysia, where Playdate is manufactured, hasn't been targeted for tariffs.

items.title: The Playdate has been out since April 2022 — here’s how it’s going
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Panic reports selling more than 50,000 Playdate handhelds since its launch in April 2022.
- New games like Celeste are now playable on the console.
- Playdate faced challenges during its launch, including a failure to launch in Malaysia.
- A second season of games for the Playdate is set to go live in 2025, featuring around a dozen games and surprises.
- Panic also introduced a new matching power adapter for the Playdate, priced at $5.
- Upcoming titles include a pinball game called 'Devils on the Moon,' set to release in 2025.
- A new pizza-themed cover for the Playdate is available in limited quantities.

items.title: Amazon is blundering into an AI copyright nightmare
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- Amazon's Suno, an AI song generation platform, is involved in a major copyright dispute.
- Major labels and the RIAA have filed lawsuits against Suno for allegedly using copyrighted materials without permission.
- Suno claims that its training data may have included copyrighted songs but argues that its use is legal under fair use.
- The integration of Suno with Amazon Alexa raises concerns about undermining artists and potentially replacing original music.
- Legal precedents, such as a Supreme Court ruling on Andy Warhol's infringement case, suggest that fair use for AI-generated music is still a contentious issue.
- The potential fallout for Suno includes high damages if found infringing and serious implications for the music industry.

items.title: Why Google made a $32 billion bet on Wiz
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google has acquired cloud security startup Wiz for $32 billion, marking its most expensive acquisition to date.
- The acquisition aims to strengthen Google Cloud's offerings amidst fierce competition from Microsoft and Amazon, whose cloud revenues exceed $105 billion.
- Wiz specializes in agentless security and rapid growth, having scaled from $1 million to $350 million in revenue over a short period.
- Google faces challenges in integrating the acquisition and navigating regulatory scrutiny, especially given a previous $23 billion negotiation that fell through due to regulatory concerns.
- The deal includes a $3.2 billion reverse termination fee, one of the highest on record, reflecting the risks involved.
- Google’s growth in security services and the acquisition of Wiz may enhance its appeal to potential customers in the rapidly evolving AI and cloud landscape.

items.title: Former USAID employees are still stuck with their work devices
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Thousands of federal employees, including USAID workers, were dismissed by Trump's administration without proper offboarding procedures.
- Former employees are left with government-issued devices that can access sensitive information, creating security risks.
- Delays in returning equipment, including laptops and phones, have left employees responsible for securing these devices, leading to concerns about data leaks.
- A federal judge ordered DOGE to reinstate email access and halt unilateral actions against USAID employees.
- The chaos affects both current and former employees, raising worries about unauthorized access and potential data breaches.
- USAID is facing scrutiny regarding the management and return of sensitive equipment overseas, as audits are initiated to assess risks and asset management.

items.title: The future of search isn’t Google — and it’s $10 a month
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Kagi is a paid search engine that costs $10/month and offers an ad-free experience with better search results.
- The service was created in response to concerns over Google's ad-centric model and data tracking practices.
- Kagi provides features like image and video search, along with customization options and various 'Lenses' to tailor search results.
- Users have full control over their search experience, including the ability to block certain domains and prioritize others.
- Kagi's index emphasizes quality over quantity, reducing SEO clutter often found in Google search results.
- Privacy is a priority as Kagi does not store user search data, although some third-party integrations may collect data.
- A free trial allows users to test Kagi with up to 100 searches before committing to a subscription.

items.title: Windows 11 now lets you easily type with an Xbox controller
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has introduced a new gamepad keyboard for Windows 11, allowing users to type using an Xbox controller.
- The gamepad keyboard improves the on-screen keyboard, providing shortcuts for Xbox buttons like X for backspace and Y for spacebar.
- This feature is aimed at enhancing usability for handheld devices and will be rolled out to all Windows 11 users soon, after beta testing since September 2024.

items.title: Windows 11 will soon let you know why your PC hardware sucks
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is introducing a new FAQ feature in Windows 11 to explain how hardware like RAM and GPU affects performance.
- The feature was found in the latest preview builds and provides answers related to GPU memory and system RAM.
- The FAQ will flag if the OS version is outdated and may include dynamic responses based on configurations.
- Previous hardware scoring systems like the Windows Experience Index have been referenced as a comparison to this new feature.
- The feature could be available to all users soon, as Microsoft tests it in the Dev Channel ahead of the 24H2 update.

items.title: Samsung’s One UI 7 is rolling out to Galaxy phones in April
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- One UI 7, based on Android 15, starts rolling out from April 7th worldwide.
- US rollout begins on April 10th, first for Galaxy S24 models, Fold 6, and Flip 6.
- Other devices to receive the update include S23 series, S24 FE, Fold 5, Flip 5, and Tab S10/S9 lines.
- Main features include AI integration with Google Gemini, natural language search, dynamic lock screen widgets, and a new Audio Eraser for videos.
- One UI 7 has been available on Galaxy S25 series since February and includes updates on Galaxy A56, A36, and A26 models.

items.title: Google’s Pixel Tablet is $120 off ahead of Amazon’s spring sales event
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Big Spring Sale runs from March 25th to March 31st.
- Google’s Pixel Tablet with a speaker dock is on sale for $399, $100 off.
- The tablet without the dock is priced at $279, $120 off, available on Amazon, Best Buy, and Google Store.
- The Pixel Tablet features an 11-inch display and Tensor G2 chip and is considered one of the best Android tablets for streaming and light gaming.

items.title: Feds charge director with $11 million fraud over his unfinished Netflix show
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Prosecutors charged director Carl Erik Rinsch with wire fraud and money laundering related to a Netflix series.
- Netflix paid $44 million for Rinsch's unfinished show originally titled *White Horse*, later renamed *Conquest*.
- Rinsch allegedly requested an additional $11 million, which he misappropriated for personal use after Netflix provided it in 2020.
- Prosecutors claim he lost over half of part of the funds in a brokerage account and spent $10 million on personal luxuries, including luxury cars and legal fees.
- The show remains incomplete, and Rinsch's erratic behavior led to Netflix terminating the development in 2021.

items.title: Democratic FTC commissioners say they were just ‘illegally fired’ by President Trump
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- President Trump fired the two remaining Democratic commissioners at the FTC, leading to claims of illegal dismissal.
- Commissioner Alvaro Bedoya called the firing an act of corruption, while Rebecca Kelly Slaughter emphasized its violation of legal precedents.
- The firings are viewed as an attempt to minimize regulatory scrutiny over corporations by a Republican-majority FTC.
- Bedoya plans to testify before Colorado's Joint House and Senate Judiciary Committees and pursue legal action against his dismissal.

items.title: Multiple Tesla vehicles were set on fire in Las Vegas and Kansas City
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Two incidents of Teslas catching fire reported in Las Vegas and Kansas City.
- In Las Vegas, a suspect threw Molotov cocktails and fired bullets at a Tesla collision center, leading to an FBI terrorism investigation.
- In Kansas City, a Cybertruck caught fire, which is also being investigated as a potential arson case.

items.title: All the news about Nvidia’s RTX 50-series GPUs
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nvidia updates its Game Ready GPU driver to 572.83, enhancing support for DLSS 4 features in over 100 games.
- A demo for Half-Life 2 RTX Remix launches on March 18, 2025, showcasing RTX 50's capabilities with advanced features.
- Nvidia denies reports of missing ROPs in RTX 50 laptop GPUs while acknowledging issues in some desktop GPUs causing performance losses.
- Nvidia admits early RTX 5080 cards had manufacturing issues related to render units, inviting affected users to seek replacements.
- A hotfix is in development to address black screen issues for RTX graphics card owners.

items.title: Tesla awarded ride-hail permit in California, a first step for robotaxis
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) granted Tesla a ride-hail permit, a necessary step for launching a robotaxi service.
- Tesla's permit allows it to transport employees in its vehicles but must notify CPUC before transporting the public.
- The company is not yet part of CPUC's autonomous vehicle passenger program, which is required for commercial driverless car services.
- CEO Elon Musk indicated that testing driverless operations would begin in Texas during the summer.
- Tesla has faced criticism over its optimistic timelines for fully autonomous vehicles and questions regarding the technology's readiness.

items.title: Tesla Unveils Cybercab and Robovan at Robotaxi Event
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Tesla CEO Elon Musk presents the prototype of the Cybercab, a fully driverless vehicle, at the Warner Bros. lot in Burbank, California.
- The surprise reveal included a new transport vehicle called the Robovan, which can be configured for mass transit or cargo.
- Musk acknowledges delays in developing a driverless vehicle, previously stating such technology was only 'two years away'.
- Reactions to the event may determine Musk’s ability to deliver competitive self-driving technology.
- The event showcased the Cybercab's sleek design, while also featuring Tesla's Optimus robots, which interacted with guests.
- The Cybercab will charge wirelessly using an inductive charger, a technology Tesla has been teasing for years.

items.title: Apple reveals Passwords app vulnerability exposed to phishing attacks for three months.
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple fixed a vulnerability in the iOS 18.2 Passwords app that lasted for three months, making users susceptible to phishing attacks.
- The vulnerability allowed unencrypted requests for icons next to stored passwords, allowing attackers on the same network to direct users to phishing sites.
- Discovered by Mysk in September 2024, Apple confirmed the bug's existence in their security updates on March 17, 2025.

items.title: A new Mission to Zyxx spin-off podcast is on the way
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary: • A new spin-off podcast, The Young Old Derf Chronicles, is being produced by Maximum Fun. • The series will consist of eight episodes focusing on the character Old Derf and his backstory. • Original cast members and co-creators including Justin Tyler and Jeremy Bent will return for this project. • The podcast aims to expand the Zyxx Quadrant Sonicmatic Universe in a humorous way. • No firm release date, but the podcast is expected to debut in late 2025, with bonus episodes leading up to the launch.

items.title: This watch has Pong and Missile Command instead of apps
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Atari is launching the [Atari 2600 My Play Watch](https://atari.com/products/atari-2600-my-play-watch-smartwatch) priced at $79.99, focusing on nostalgia rather than functionality.
- The watch features classic games like Centipede, Pong, Super Breakout, and Missile Command, playable via touchscreen or a crown dial paddle controller.
- Preorders are available now, with expected shipping by June 10, 2025.
- The watch includes swappable watch faces and basic fitness tracking but lacks Bluetooth or Wi-Fi capabilities, limiting its functionality beyond gaming.
- Upgrades from the Space Invaders version include a larger 2.02-inch touchscreen and an upgraded industrial design with three limited-time band options.

items.title: US music subscriptions cross 100 million as digital downloads drop
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
• Music streaming services in the US surpassed 100 million subscribers in 2024, according to RIAA's revenue report.
• Overall revenue from paid subscriptions and ad-supported services reached $14.9 billion, a 4% increase from the previous year.
• Vinyl sales continue to grow, surpassing CDs for the third consecutive year with $1.4 billion in revenue, while digital downloads dropped by 14.9%.

items.title: Nvidia says ‘the age of generalist robotics is here’
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nvidia announced the availability of Isaac GR00T N1, an open-source, customizable foundation model for humanoid robots.
- CEO Jensen Huang stated, "The age of generalist robotics is here," highlighting advancements in AI-driven robot development.
- The framework allows robotics developers to create more adaptable and capable robots, focusing on human-robot companionship rather than mere tool functionality.
- Demonstrations included 1X’s NEO Gamma robot performing autonomous tasks using the GR00T N1 model.
- Early users of GR00T N1 include Boston Dynamics, Agility Robotics, and Neura Robotics.
- The model features a dual-system architecture: System 1 for quick reflexive actions and System 2 for reasoning and planning actions based on environmental understanding.
- Developers can customize the GR00T N1 model using data from human demonstrations or simulations, with downloadable training data available on Hugging Face and GitHub.

items.title: Nvidia’s RTX Pro 6000 has 96GB of VRAM and 600W of power
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Nvidia announces the RTX Pro Blackwell series of GPUs, including the RTX Pro 6000 for workstations.
- RTX Pro 6000 features 96GB of GDDR7 memory and requires 600W of power.
- It supports PCIe Gen 5 and DisplayPort 2.1, with enhanced RT cores and Tensor cores.
- Designed for professionals in game development and AI workloads, with variants in Max-Q and server editions.
- Pricing for the RTX Pro 6000 is not yet set; it will be available in April through partners like PNY and TD Synnex, with manufacturer availability in May.
- Cloud service providers will offer the server variant later this year, with the rest of the RTX Pro Blackwell lineup available in summer.

items.title: Nvidia's New AI Supercomputers: DGX Spark and DGX Station Revealed
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Nvidia launched DGX Spark and DGX Station personal AI supercomputers at GTC conference.
- DGX Spark, previously called Digits, will be available for preorder at $3,000.
- Designed for large AI model work, the DGX Station's price is unannounced but is geared toward AI developers and researchers.
- DGX Spark features GB10 Blackwell Superchip with 128GB memory and can perform up to 1,000 trillion operations per second.
- DGX Station boasts 20 petaflops of AI performance, using the new GB300 Blackwell Ultra chip.
- Collaborations with Asus, Dell, HP, and others for custom versions of the DGX supercomputers are set for release this summer.

items.title: JD Vance tries to mend the MAGA-Tech divide
items.author: Tina Nguyen
items.summary:
- JD Vance acknowledges tension between the MAGA right and tech billionaires at the American Dynamism policy conference.
- He calls for a truce between these factions within the Republican party.
- Vance seeks to reconcile the populist views against tech globalization, advocating for a united front against a common enemy - the government.

items.title: Oracle is reportedly in the lead to save TikTok from US ban
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Oracle is negotiating a deal to ensure TikTok's security in exchange for a minor stake in its US operations.
- The agreement may include guarantees preventing a backdoor access for the Chinese government.
- Concerns remain about TikTok’s algorithm potentially staying under the control of its parent company, ByteDance.
- Previous efforts, known as Project Texas, aimed to address security issues but faced skepticism from US authorities.
- A deadline is approaching, with Vice President JD Vance suggesting a high-level agreement to resolve national security concerns by April 5th.

items.title: Nvidia announces Blackwell Ultra GB300 and Vera Rubin, its next AI ‘superchips’
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nvidia announces two new AI chips: Blackwell Ultra GB300 and Vera Rubin.
- Blackwell Ultra GB300 expected to ship in the second half of 2025, while Vera Rubin is set for 2026 and Rubin Ultra for 2027.
- Blackwell Ultra offers 20 petaflops of AI performance with 288GB of HBM3e memory.
- a Blackwell Ultra DGX GB300 cluster features 288 CPUs, 576 GPUs, and 11.5 exaflops of FP4 computing.
- New chips aim to provide improved performance over previous models, with Vera Rubin claiming up to 50 petaflops of FP4.
- Nvidia's founder emphasizes the increasing demand for computing power, predicting the industry will need "100 times more than then we thought we needed this time last year."

items.title: Democratic FCC Commissioner Geoffrey Starks will resign this spring
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- FCC Commissioner Geoffrey Starks announced his resignation, effective spring 2024.
- Starks' departure may enable a Republican majority on the commission prior to Senate confirmation of Olivia Trusty.
- His resignation cuts his term short, which was originally set to expire in 2027.
- Starks expressed that serving as a Commissioner was the honor of his life, highlighting the importance of listening to the American people.

items.title: Microsoft’s Xbox Adaptive Joystick is now available
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Xbox Adaptive Joystick is designed for players with limited mobility and is now available for purchase through Microsoft’s online store for $29.99.
- It was announced at the Microsoft Ability Summit on March 18, 2025, after being initially revealed in August 2024 with a planned early 2025 release.
- Key features include customizable buttons, 3D printable accessories, four remappable buttons, an Xbox thumbstick, and compatibility with Microsoft's Adaptive Controller.

items.title: Our five favorite dunks from Drake’s label over his ‘Not Like Us’ lawsuit
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Universal Music Group (UMG) responds to Drake's lawsuit claiming defamation from Kendrick Lamar's diss track "Not Like Us."
- UMG argues that Drake's lawsuit should be dismissed as he is a "sore loser" in a rap battle.
- Drake previously signed a letter opposing the use of his lyrics in criminal cases, highlighting irony in his current lawsuit.
- UMG points out the expectation of aggressive lyrics in the context of the diss track due to prior exchanges between the artists.
- UMG counters allegations that "Not Like Us" called for violence and claims Drake's own lyrics are equally harsh.
- UMG states that controversies referenced in "Not Like Us" were already well-known and publicly documented.
- UMG disputes Drake's claims of manipulated streaming through bots and payola, calling them unsupported and speculative.

items.title: Chip race: Microsoft, Meta, Google, and Nvidia battle it out for AI chip supremacy
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Intel is testing its 18A chip process again after previous failures, involving both Nvidia and Broadcom.
- Nvidia's upcoming AI chip, Blackwell Ultra, will be announced at its GTC keynote on March 18 and expected to launch in the second half of the year.
- OpenAI plans to launch its in-house AI chip next year, produced by TSMC using advanced 3-nanometer technology.
- Intel is canceling its Falcon Shores chip and focusing resources on Jaguar Shores instead.
- Nvidia's market cap fell by almost $600 billion following competition from DeepSeek, a new Chinese AI startup.
- An antitrust investigation has been opened in China regarding Nvidia's acquisition of Mellanox after concerns over compliance with previous commitments.

items.title: GM taps Nvidia to boost its embattled self-driving projects
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Nvidia partners with GM at its annual GTC conference to develop advanced automotive technologies.
- GM will utilize Nvidia’s Omniverse and AI training software for robotics and manufacturing efficiency.
- Enhanced vehicles will feature Nvidia’s Drive AGX system-on-a-chip for autonomous capabilities and high-performance compute.
- GM's past efforts with autonomous vehicles have faced challenges and funding cuts following safety concerns.
- Nvidia expects its automotive sector to grow significantly despite current low penetration in vehicle markets.
- This partnership adds GM to a growing list of automakers collaborating with Nvidia.

items.title: Wait, why is the White House using Starlink to ‘improve Wi-Fi’?
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The White House aims to improve Wi-Fi connectivity using Starlink due to poor cell service and strained Wi-Fi infrastructure.
- Starlink service is being piped from a government data center rather than being installed directly.
- Critics question the necessity of using Starlink when simpler solutions could suffice, and there are concerns about ethics and security.

items.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows finally showed me the appeal of Ubisoft’s tentpole franchise
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - Assassin’s Creed Shadows brings the franchise to Japan after 20 years and 13 mainline games. - The game revives the dual protagonist system from Assassin’s Creed Syndicate, featuring characters Naoe and Yasuke. - Players can switch between Naoe, a stealth character, and Yasuke, a bruiser, after initial gameplay hours. - The narrative follows Naoe’s quest for vengeance and Yasuke’s journey to find his place as a samurai. - Combat systems are simple, with both characters offering distinct styles suited to different gameplay approaches. - Ubisoft focuses on detailed recreations of Japan’s historical era and cultural elements within the game world. - Shadows will launch on March 20th for Xbox, PlayStation, and PC.

items.title: Analogue’s 4K Nintendo 64 retro console has been delayed, again
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- The Analogue 3D console's release has been delayed to "by July 2025."
- Originally scheduled for 2024, then Q1 2025.
- It will retail for $249.99 and is designed for 4K output and Bluetooth controller support.
- Analogue assures a 100% refund policy on canceled pre-orders.
- Competing product teaser by ModRetro has surfaced amid the delay.

items.title: HP’s Omen 16 Slim Gaming Laptop Features RTX 5070 GPU
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- HP introduces the Omen 16 Slim, a 16-inch gaming laptop with a thickness of 20mm (0.79 inches).
- The laptop is designed for midrange specs, featuring an Nvidia RTX 5070 GPU.
- Expected to launch in June without finalized pricing.
- It includes a 16-inch display with a 2560 x 1600 resolution, 240Hz refresh rate, and 3ms response time.
- Powered by Intel's Arrow Lake CPUs, with configurations ranging from Core Ultra 5 225H to Core Ultra 9 285H.
- Storage starts at 512GB, and RAM at 16GB.
- Weighs 5.4 pounds, still portable but not the thinnest on the market compared to competitors like Razer's Blade 16.
- It features a variety of ports, including USB-C with Power Delivery, USB-A ports, ethernet, HDMI 2.1, and Wi-Fi 6E support.
- Other models in the Omen line expected to be refreshed alongside the 16 Slim, including Omen 17 and Victus 15.

items.title: HP Launches 18 New OmniBook Models including Ultra-Light Aero
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- HP introduces 18 new OmniBook productivity laptop models across various lines including OmniBook 3, 5, 7, and X.
- Notable model: HP OmniBook 7 Aero, weighing 2.2 pounds with AMD Ryzen AI 7 350 capabilities and options for up to 1TB SSD and 32GB RAM.
- Ports include two USB-C (10Gbps), two USB-A, HDMI 2.1, and a 3.5mm audio jack, alongside a display option of either 1920 x 1200 or 2560 x 1600 resolution.
- HP is experimenting with lattice-less keyboard designs in some models, while also refreshing 20 EliteBook models emphasizing local AI capabilities.

items.title: Every gaming headset should have a backup mic like the new Cloud III S Wireless
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- HyperX announces the Cloud III S Wireless gaming headset with Bluetooth 5.3 and an additional backup microphone for calls.
- Offers up to 200 hours of battery life in Bluetooth mode and 120 hours with 2.4GHz wireless.
- Features a removable boom mic and a hidden omni-directional mic for versatile use.
- Includes magnetic earcup covers allowing customization with different designs.
- Same specifications as the Cloud III, including 53mm drivers and cushy earcups for comfort.
- Launch expected in May, pricing details yet to be finalized but similar to the previous model starting at around $150.

items.title: The first new Pebble smartwatches are coming later this year
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Eric Migicovsky is launching two new Pebble smartwatches through his new company, Core Devices.
- The first watch is called the Core 2 Duo, priced at $149, set to ship in July with over 30 days of battery life.
- The second model, Core Time 2, will ship in December for $225 and features a touchscreen.
- Both models retain key features from older Pebble watches and emphasize long battery life and customization.
- Challenges remain with manufacturing, software integration, and connecting with iPhones.

items.title: Google's Gemini gets conversational coding and an AI podcast maker
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- Google has released two new features for its Gemini AI assistant: Canvas and Audio Overviews.
- Canvas provides a workspace for creating and editing documents and code in real-time, with live previews for coding projects.
- The Audio Overview feature turns written content into a podcast-style discussion between two AI hosts, currently available only in English.
- These features are rolling out globally for Gemini and Gemini Advanced subscribers.
- Competitors like Anthropic and OpenAI have launched similar features, with naming conventions leading to competitive overlaps.

items.title: Satellite Launch Kicks Off New Effort to Monitor Wildfires from Space
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- A prototype satellite was launched as part of the Google-backed initiative FireSat to detect wildfires from space.
- This is the first of at least 50 satellites planned for the FireSat constellation, developed by the Earth Fire Alliance and Muon Space.
- The project received $13 million from Google.org and support from Google Research team.
- FireSat aims to provide early detection of fires as small as 5 x 5 meters, outperforming previous satellites that needed fires to grow to two acres.
- The first launch occurred at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on March 14th, with three additional satellites planned for 2026 and full operational capacity expected by 2030.

items.title: NASA’s Crew-10 mission lifts off as the Starliner astronauts prepare to come home
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- NASA’s SpaceX Crew-10 mission launched on March 14, 2025, successfully sending astronauts to the ISS.
- Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, stranded on the ISS for nine months, will return on the Crew-9 capsule.
- The return is scheduled for March 19, following delays due to Starliner spacecraft issues.
- The Crew-10 mission is critical in reuniting the stranded astronauts with the Earth after prolonged stay due to thruster and helium leak issues.

items.title: Lego announces Pokémon sets are coming next year
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Lego has announced that Pokémon building sets will be released in 2026.
- Specific details regarding the sets and characters are yet to be revealed, but Pikachu's tail is hinted at in the teaser.
- Previous Pokémon building sets were available through Mattel’s Mega line, but it’s unclear if Lego will have exclusivity in the future.

items.title: Nanoleaf’s new immersive backlight kit plugs directly into your PC
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nanoleaf has released a new PC Screen Mirror Lightstrip with 75 color-changing LEDs.
- The lightstrip plugs directly into a PC's USB port and requires no additional hardware.
- Available for preorder for $49.99, shipping expected by end of March 2025.
- Designed for monitors up to 32 inches, with a flexible adhesive design for easy installation.
- Allows users to choose from 16 million colors through the desktop app, can mirror gameplay colors, and serve as an audio visualizer.
- Features integration with Nanoleaf Premium subscription for advanced music sync capabilities.

items.title: Hundreds of celebrities warn against letting OpenAI and Google ‘freely exploit’ Hollywood
Switch 2, Steam Deck, and the next-gen console wars
